perturbation.original_text: This Strategic Alliance Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of May 17, 2016, (the "Effective Date") by and between Giggles N' Hugs, Inc., a Nevada corporation (the "Company"), and Kiddo, Inc., a Florida corporation, Inc., ("Consultant").
perturbation.changed_text: This Strategic Alliance Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of May 17, 2016, (the "Effective Date") by and between Giggles N' Hugs, Inc., a Nevada corporation (the "Corporation"), and Kiddo, Inc., a Florida corporation, Inc., ("Partner").
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Company' and 'Consultant' are replaced with 'Corporation' and 'Partner' respectively without redefining their obligations. This introduces ambiguity regarding the roles and responsibilities of each entity, creating uncertainty in enforcement. The original designated the parties as 'Company' and 'Consultant', clearly defining their primary relationship. By switching to 'Corporation' and 'Partner', the agreement now implies a potentially different type of association, which can be misinterpreted without clear definitions.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant will not, during the Term, and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, directly or indirectly: (i) solicit, recruit or promote the solicitation or recruitment of any employee or consultant of the Company for the purpose of encouraging that employee or consultant to leave the Company's employ or sever an agreement for services; or (ii) solicit, participate in or promote the solicitation of any of the Company's clients, customers, or prospective customers with whom Consultant had a Material Contact (hereinafter defined) and/or regarding whom Consultant received Confidential Information, for the purpose of providing products or services ("Competitive Products/Services").
perturbation.changed_text: Partner will not, during the Term, and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, directly or indirectly: (i) solicit, recruit or promote the solicitation or recruitment of any employee or subcontractor of the Corporation for the purpose of encouraging that employee or subcontractor to leave the Corporation's employ or terminate a service agreement; or (ii) solicit, participate in or promote the solicitation of any of the Corporation's clients, consumers, or prospective consumers with whom Partner had a Meaningful Contact (hereinafter defined) and/or regarding whom Partner received Proprietary Information, for the purpose of providing products or services ("Competing Products/Services").
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Consultant', 'employee', 'consultant', 'Company', 'clients', 'customers', 'Material Contact', 'Confidential Information' and 'Competitive Products/Services' are replaced with 'Partner', 'employee', 'subcontractor', 'Corporation', 'clients', 'consumers', 'Meaningful Contact', 'Proprietary Information' and 'Competing Products/Services' respectively without redefining them. This could lead to different interpretations of the scope of the non-solicitation clause, especially regarding what constitutes a 'Meaningful Contact' versus a 'Material Contact' or what is 'Proprietary' versus merely 'Confidential'. It is uncertain whether 'terminate a service agreement' is same as 'sever an agreement for services'.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant hereby irrevocably transfers and assigns to the Company, and agrees to irrevocably transfer and assign to the Company, all right, title and interest in and to the Innovations, including all worldwide patent rights (including patent applications and disclosures), copyright rights, mask work rights, trade secret rights, know-how, and any and all other intellectual property or proprietary rights (collectively, "Intellectual Property Rights") therein.
perturbation.changed_text: Partner hereby irrevocably transfers and assigns to the Corporation, and agrees to irrevocably transfer and assign to the Corporation, all right, title and interest in and to the Innovations, including all worldwide patent entitlements (including patent submissions and revelations), copyright privileges, design rights, commercial secret privileges, expertise, and any and all other intellectual property or exclusive rights (collectively, "Creative Assets") therein.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Consultant', 'Company', 'patent rights', 'patent applications and disclosures', 'copyright rights', 'mask work rights', 'trade secret rights', 'know-how', 'intellectual property or proprietary rights', and 'Intellectual Property Rights' are replaced with 'Partner', 'Corporation', 'patent entitlements', 'patent submissions and revelations', 'copyright privileges', 'design rights', 'commercial secret privileges', 'expertise', 'intellectual property or exclusive rights', and 'Creative Assets' respectively. The substitution of legal terms with similar but differently nuanced alternatives creates ambiguity. The term Creative Assets is a broad category and may not offer the same protection as Intellectual Property Rights and the like.
